replies.body: I don't have proof to back this up, but hitboxes get seriously messed up whenever you walk inside of minions, even if you're on the other side of them.  I don't know why or how, but most incidents I've seen tend to involve having come out of or been inside a minion.  It's almost like the netcode that updates character positioning goes off the wall when passing through minions.

So you going to raytrace a target.
so you send out a beam but sometimes it utterly misses the clipping.
So instead of sending out a beam your going to sweep a small circle as the ray expands outward.
Giving you way less chance of missing the clip.

in the case of 3d engines you use a ellipsoid as you get a lot of feedback too regarding the surface angle you hit 
even if the ellipsoid misses a object edge during is circular travel it will clip another.

There are a few reasons I can think of here:
  - Minion hitboxes are a lot smaller than champion hitboxes (so you can get hooked while being graphically behind them since your box extends further forward than the minion's)
  - Rito hitboxes (not trying to meme... they're genuinely pretty bad)
  - Blitz hook is super wide compared to how it looks
  - At max range of skillshots, it balloons out even wider than point #3 ... I think there's a reason why but idk it.  I just know it does it.  It leads to a lot of hooks like Blitz/thresh just jumping 3 or 4 teemos to the left/right it seems just to hit you.

I quit playing a while ago because of the bugs (but I visit the boards to get a tldr of kind of what is going on in LoL from time to time), and just how unfun this game is to play.  Lol it's nice to know that this stuff still happens to others and it is still just as confusing.

Too many champs in this game function as tools.

I suspect this is due to the following:

* Champion hitboxes are bigger than minion hitboxes.
* Champion animation isn't 100% consistent to hitbox location, especially when mid-stride.
* Blitzcrank grabs the first champion that *any* part of the hook hitbox hits.

From the video, it looks like MF is at the most forward part of her walk animation (i.e. the furthest in that direction compared to her actual in-game location), and the hook taps a handful of pixels on the outer edge of your hitbox before it hits anything else.
